verses.roman:
yamunāra bhrame prabhu dhāñā calilā
alakṣite yāi' sindhu-jale jhāṅpa dilā

synonyms: yamunāra bhrame—by mistaking for the Yamunā; prabhu—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; dhāñā calilā—began to run very swiftly; alakṣite—without being seen; yāi'-going; sindhu-jale—into the water of the sea; jhāṅpa dilā—He jumped.
translation: Mistaking the sea for the Yamunā, the Lord ran swiftly and jumped into the water, unseen by the others.
